page.title: 08WESTBURY VINEYARD/FARM
page.content: Westbury Farm was the old Tudor Manor House of Purley Parva.The foundations of a barn date back to the first Domesday Book and aerial photographs show evidence of a medieval village. The Thames Valley was famous from Roman times for producing wines. Mr Theobald, the proprietor, decided to change to grape growing in 1969. He was the first to follow a new growing method using well_spaced, high supports.From the original twenty varieties he selected ten for wine-making _ more than any other grower in this country.He is the only grower to produce red as well as white wine.Covering over fifteen acres it is one of the largest vineyards.
